11 import rospy

14 import pybullet as p

16 sys.path.append("/catkin_ws/src/jointcontrol/scripts")
17 from controllers import *
18 
19 class jointcontrol_env(gym.Env):
20  """!@brief Class implementing the control problem as a Gym Environment
21 
22  Observation Space:
23  List of currently set params
24 
25  Action Space:
26  List of how much to change each controller param
27 
28  Reward:
29  Negative mean squared error of control offset
30 
31  """
32  def __init__(self, **kwargs):
33  """ Class constructor """
34  # Get current joint index from keyword arguments
35  self.jointidx = kwargs.get('jointidx', 0)
36 
37  # Load joint controller configuration from ros parameter server
38  assert rospy.has_param("/jointcontrol")
39  params = rospy.get_param("/jointcontrol")
40  assert params["NumJoints"]>self.jointidx
41  self.jointParams = params["J{}".format(self.jointidx)]
42 
43  # Define action space as box[-1, 1] with the same length as the params
44  # Actions are scaled to the different gains, in order for the action noise distribution to be the same for every entry
45  self.action_space = spaces.Box(
46  np.array( [ -1 for _ in self.jointParams["MaxChange"] ], dtype=np.float32 ),
47  np.array( [ 1 for _ in self.jointParams["MaxChange"] ], dtype=np.float32 )
48  )
49 
50  # Define observation space as box with minimum and maximum controller params
51  self.observation_space = spaces.Box (
52  np.array(self.jointParams["Minimums"], dtype=np.float32),
53  np.array(self.jointParams["Maximums"], dtype=np.float32)
54  )
55 
56  # Instantiate controller as a blueprint to store ts and set params
57  self.controllerBlueprint = strategy4Controller(ts=params["SimParams"]["Ts"])
58  self.controllerBlueprint.updateConstants(self.jointParams["Defaults"])
59 
60  self.controllerInstance = None # Current controller instance
61  self.currentParams = None # Currently set control params
62  self.controlSignal = None # Control signal that is applied each step
63  self.numSteps = 0 # Number of performed steps this episode
64  self.maxSteps = 0 # Maximum number of steps per episode
65  self.latestTrajectory = None # Stores the trajectory resulting from the latest sim step
66  self.ts = params["SimParams"]["Ts"] # Stores time discretisation in order to properly visualise trajectories
67 
68  # Connect to the bullet server
69  self.physicsClient = p.connect(p.SHARED_MEMORY)
70 
71  # Init ROS node
72  try:
73  rospy.init_node("j{}GymEnv".format(self.jointidx))
74  except rospy.exceptions.ROSException:
75  pass
76 
77  # Create ROS publisher & subscriber to synchronise with physics server
78  self.ready = False
79  self.syncSub = rospy.Subscriber("jointcontrol/globalEnvSync", jointMetric, self.syncCallback)
80  self.syncPub = rospy.Publisher("jointcontrol/envSync", jointMetric, queue_size = 1)
81 
82  def __del__(self):
83  """ Class Deconstructor """
84  p.disconnect()
85 
86  # Gym Env methods
87  # ----------------------------
88  def step(self, action):
89  """
90  Performs one simulation (as defined with episodeType and config params in env.reset()).
91 
92  If action is set to None, a step is performed without changing internal params of the controller.
93  """
94  # An action of none corresponds to changes of 0 for each param
95  if np.any(action == None): action = [ 0 for _ in self.jointParams["Defaults"] ]
96 
97  # If action is not within action space, terminate the episode and return
98  if False in [ -1 <= a <= 1 for a in action ]:
99  return self.formatObs(), -10, True, {}
100 
101  action = self.actionToParams(action)
102 
103  # Calculate current controller params after action
104  self.currentParams += np.array(action)
105 
106  # If action puts the state outside of the observation space, terminate episode and return
107  # This test is deactivated for now, until more sophisticated model testing
108  #if False in [ a <= b <= c for a, b, c in zip(self.jointParams["Minimums"], self.currentParams, self.jointParams["Maximums"]) ]:
109  # return self.formatObs(), -10, True, {}
110 
111  # Clip controller params to Min/Max
112  np.clip(
113  self.currentParams,
114  self.jointParams["Minimums"],
115  self.jointParams["Maximums"],
116  out = self.currentParams
117  )
118 
119  # Set joint to initial position
120  while abs( self.getJointState()[0] - self.controlSignal[0]) > 0.05:
121  self.positionControlUpdate(cmdForce=100, cmdPos=self.controlSignal[0])
122  self.waitForPhysicsUpdate()
123  # Deactivate position control before proceeding
124  self.positionControlUpdate()
125  self.waitForPhysicsUpdate()
126 
127  # Update controller instance
128  self.controllerInstance.updateConstants(self.currentParams)
129 
130  resultingPos = [] # Variable to track resulting motor position
131  feedback = self.getJointState() # Variable to track bullet joint feedback
132 
133  # Iterate over controlsignal
134  for entry in self.controlSignal:
135  # Calculate output torque and apply it to the joint
136  # Since we only test postion control, the vel and effort commands are set to 0
137  torque = PWM2Torque(
138  self.controllerInstance.update([entry, 0, 0], feedback),
139  maxMotorTorque=self.jointParams["MaxTorque"]
140  )
141  self.torqueControlUpdate(torque)
142  # Wait for synchronisation
143  self.waitForPhysicsUpdate()
144  # Get joint feedback & correct torque value (it is not reported by bullet in torque mode)
145  feedback = self.getJointState()
146  feedback[2] = torque
147  # Log feedback for reward calculation
148  resultingPos.append(feedback[0])
149 
150  # Calculate reward
151  reward = self.compute_reard(resultingPos, self.controlSignal, {})
152 
153  # Keep track of resulting trajectory
154  self.latestTrajectory = resultingPos
155 
156  # Check if end of episode is reached
157  if self.numSteps < self.maxSteps:
158  self.numSteps += 1
159  done = False
160  else:
161  done = True
162 
163  # Return
164  return self.formatObs(), reward, done, {}
165 
166  def reset(self, episodeType='step', config={ "initialPos":0, "stepPos":-1.57, "samplesPerStep":80, "maxSteps":40 }):
167  """
168  Resets environment and returns env observation
169 
170  The control signal for an episode can be set using the episodeType param and configured using config, a dictionary defining the episode configuration.
171  Implemented episode types are 'step' and 'custom'. They are configured using these params in the config dict:
172 
173  step (default):
174  performs a step response from initialPos to stepPos
175  - initialPos [float]: Initial position before step
176  - stepPos [float]: Position after step
177  - samplesPerStep [int]: Number of discrete controller updates per performed step response
178  - maxSteps [int]: Number of performed step responses per episode
179 
180  customSignal:
181  performs a custom response (raw input signal is provided in config)
182  - inSignal [list of floats] Applied control signal for each step
183  - maxSteps [int]: Number of performed step responses per episode
184 
185  square:
186  performs response to a square input signal
187  - lowerSignal: Input signal when wave is low
188  - higherSignal: Input signal when wave is high
189  - pulseLength: Length of each low and high pulse
190  - numPulses: Number of performed pulses
191  - maxSteps [int]: Number of performed step responses per episode
192 
193  generator:
194  performs a custom response (a generator object is provided in config)
195  - inSignal [generator] Generator object for generaring control signal
196  - maxSteps [int]: Number of performed step responses per episode
197 
198  Switching between types of control signals is implemented using a dict and each episodeType is implemented as its own method.
199  In order to use any response other than 'step', the reset method must be called as env.env.reset(episodeType=.., config=..) instead of env.reset() due to how Gym's inheritance is implemented.
200  """
201  def step(self, config):
202  """ Creates and configures step response """
203  # Create step response as a simple list and set number of performed tests per episode
204  self.controlSignal = [config["initialPos"]] + [ config["stepPos"] for _ in range(config["samplesPerStep"]-1) ]
205  self.maxSteps = config["maxSteps"]
206 
207  def customSignal(self, config):
208  """ Configures custom signal """
209  # Set custom signal and number of performed tests per episode
210  self.controlSignal = config["inSignal"]
211  self.maxSteps = config["maxSteps"]
212 
213  def square(self, config):
214  """ Creates and configures square signal response """
215  # Create single pulse as simple list
216  pulse = [ config["lowerSignal"] for _ in range(config["pulseLength"]) ] + [ config["higherSignal"] for _ in range(config["pulseLength"]) ]
217  # Append single pulse multiple times to pulseSignal in order to create the whole signal
218  pulseSignal = []
219  for _ in range(config["numPulses"]): pulseSignal += pulse
220  # Set signal and number of performed tests per episode
221  self.controlSignal = pulseSignal
222  self.maxSteps = config["maxSteps"]
223 
224  def generator(self, config):
225  """ Creates and configures an input signal based on a generator """
226  pass
227 
228  # Create dict to mimick switch statement between different modes
229  episodeTypes = {
230  "step": step,
231  "customSignal": customSignal,
232  "square": square,
233  "generator": generator
234  }
235 
236  # Instantiate controller with default params
237  self.controllerInstance = copy.deepcopy(self.controllerBlueprint)
238  self.currentParams = np.array(self.jointParams["Defaults"], dtype=np.float64)
239 
240  # Create control signal based on set mode
241  try:
242  episodeTypes[episodeType](self, config)
243  except KeyError:
244  # Handle KeyError by setting up an empty episode
245  self.controlSignal = [0]
246  self.maxSteps = 0
247 
248  # Set perfomed steps for this episode to 0 and return
249  self.numSteps = 0
250  return self.formatObs()
251 
252  def render(self, mode="human"):
253  # No need to render, as it happens in ROS
254  pass
255 
256  # Gym GoalEnv methods
257  # ----------------------------
258  def compute_reard(self, achieved_goal, goal, info):
259  """
260  Computes reward of currently achieved vs. the global goal
261 
262  In this context, the achieved goal is the actual plant position, while the actual goal is to follow the control signal as closely as possible
263 
264  """
265  squaredError = np.square(
266  np.array(achieved_goal) - np.array(goal)
267  )
268  return -1*squaredError.mean()
269 
270  # Environment-specific methods
271  # ----------------------------
272  def formatObs(self):
273  """ Formats observation """
274  obs = self.currentParams
275  return obs
276 
277  def actionToParams(self, action):
278  """ Scales action from [-1, 1] to physical controller params """
279  return np.multiply(
280  np.array(action),
281  np.array(self.jointParams["MaxChange"], dtype=np.float64)
282  )
283 
284  def paramsToAction(self, params):
285  """ Scales controller params to action space of [-1, 1] """
286  return np.divide(
287  np.array(self.jointParams["MaxChange"], dtype=np.float64),
288  np.array(params)
289  )
290 
291  def getJointState(self):
292  """ Returns Jointstate in form [pos, vel, effort] """
293  js = p.getJointState(self.jointParams["RobotID"], self.jointParams["SegmentID"])
294  # Return without information about reaction forces
295  return [js[0], js[1], js[3]]
296 
297  def positionControlUpdate(self, cmdForce=0, cmdPos=0):
298  """ Sets up position control for the next physics update """
299  # Set target for next update
300  mode = p.POSITION_CONTROL
301  p.setJointMotorControl2(self.jointParams["RobotID"], self.jointParams["SegmentID"], controlMode=mode, force=cmdForce, targetPosition=cmdPos)
302 
303  def torqueControlUpdate(self, torque):
304  """ Sets up torque control for the next physics update """
305  mode = p.TORQUE_CONTROL
306  p.setJointMotorControl2(self.jointParams["RobotID"], self.jointParams["SegmentID"], controlMode=mode, force=torque)
307 
308  def loadBulletTarget(self):
309  """ Reloads jointparams from ROS in order to enable changing of the testscene without terminating the env """
310  params = rospy.get_param("/jointcontrol")
311  self.jointParams = params["J{}".format(self.jointidx)]
312 
313  def syncCallback(self, data):
314  """ Callback for synchronisation messages """
315  if not True in data.ready:
316  self.ready = False
317 
318  def waitForPhysicsUpdate(self):
319  """ Synchronises env with physics server using ROS messages """
320  # Publish message indicating that env is ready for sim step
321  self.ready = True
322  self.syncPub.publish(
323  jointMetric( [ False for _ in range(self.jointidx) ] + [ True ] )
324  )
325  while self.ready:
326  time.sleep(1/10000)
327 
328  def visualiseTrajectory(self):
329  """ Plots control signal vs. resulting trajectory using matplotlib """
330  plt.plot(
331  self.ts*np.arange(len(self.controlSignal)),
332  self.controlSignal,
333  label = "Control Signal"
334  )
335  if self.latestTrajectory != None:
336  plt.plot(
337  self.ts*np.arange(len(self.latestTrajectory)),
338  self.latestTrajectory,
339  label = "Resulting Position"
340  )
341  plt.xlabel("Time [s]")
342  plt.ylabel("Joint Position [rad]")
343  plt.legend()
344  plt.show()
